de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment

Interface PayTerminal


  • public interface PayTerminal
    Project: LUIS ePayment

    This is the central class to use the payment facilities of LUIS ePayment. An instance of this class will be generated by the PaySession.login() method. Don't create an instance of this class directly. This will not work.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.32 $
    Author:
    M. Gelfort

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static short CARD_TYPE_HEALTH_INSURANCE
      Constant value 1 for a special chip card used in german health care environment.
      static short DIAGNOSE_EMV
      Flag with value 3 to configure the EFT (electronic pay terminal) with EMV parameters from the network provider
      static short DIAGNOSE_EXTENDED
      Constant value 1 for a check of the payment terminal together with a network check of the provider.
      static short DIAGNOSE_NORMAL
      Constant value 0 for a simple check of the payment terminal
      static short DIAGNOSE_TKM
      Constant value 2 for a check of the payment terminal together with a check, if there are some TKM messages available for this payment terminal on the side of the provider.
      static int PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC
      Constant value 0 for a limit driven payment transaction.
      static int PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE
      Constant value 2 for a pure offline transaction.
      static int PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN
      Constant value 3 for an online transaction without any PIN input.
      static int PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN
      Constant value 1 for a PIN based online transaction.
      static short RECEIPT_TYPE_ADMINISTRATOR
      Constant value 2 which defines a receipt as for the administrator of the EFT.
      static short RECEIPT_TYPE_CUSTOMER
      Constant value 0 which defines a receipt as for the customer.
      static short RECEIPT_TYPE_DEFAULT
      Sets the default receipt type, if no type was given.
      static short RECEIPT_TYPE_MERCHANT
      Constant value 1 which defines a receipt as for the merchant.

      • PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC

        static final int PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC
        Constant value 0 for a limit driven payment transaction. The EFT decides if the transaction will be done online or offline, depending on its limits the network provider has given during an extended network diagnose.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN

        static final int PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN
        Constant value 1 for a PIN based online transaction. No fallback to offline transactions is done, in case of an unavailable network provider.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE

        static final int PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE
        Constant value 2 for a pure offline transaction. No online tests will be done, even if the network provider is online available.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • login

        void login()
    throws PayException
        If one has logged out by using the PayTerminal.logout() method or if you received a NotLoggedInException, then you can login again with this method.

        But the normal way to login is a call of PaySession.login().

        Throws:
        PayException

      • logout

        void logout()
     throws PayException
        Can be called to logout from LUIS ePayment. One can login several times to LUIS ePayment (technically one is logged in only once), but one logout terminates it all.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • isLoggedIn

        boolean isLoggedIn()
        Method to check, if you are still logged into the payment terminal.
        Returns:
        true, if logged in; false otherwise

      • payment

        PayTransaction payment(long cents,
                       int payType,
                       ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                       PayMedia media)
                throws PayException
        This method starts a payment transaction. Several parameters define the way of the transaction.

        The payment transaction is a two step thing. Step one is to start the transaction, whereas step two finishes it. Like in databases, this finishing has two endings:

        • The transaction will be committed
        • The transaction will be rolled back
        This method starts the transaction and returns an instance of a newly created PayTransaction object. This instance allows a commit or rollback of the transaction. But you don't have to waste time. After some time (in many payment terminals it are only 3 minutes) the payment terminal will automatically rollback its transaction. The trasaction will also get rolled back, if you start something new (eg. a cash crop). So its a good advice to commit/rollback the transaction after the next minute.

        Many application use this 2-step transaction to print their receipt. If this printing fails or if the delivery of the payed goods turns out to have some problems, then the whole payment transaction can be cancelled. The first step checks the payment media, checks the network provider and checks the fund of the transaction against the given card. If something went wrong, you will never get a PayTransaction instance, but a PayException.

        Before the second step, one can check the hardware, print the bill, do something with the goods. And only then one can commit or rollback the transaction.

        But use a timer to not run out of time and the payment terminal starts an automatic cancellation by itself.

        Some eft devices don't support a 2-step transaction. In that case, the returned PayTransaction object is null and the transaction is autocommitted by the device. So check the returned PayTransaction instance for null, before calling commit or rollback.

        Parameters:
        cents - The fund used for the payment of goods.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • payment

        PayTransaction payment(long cents,
                       int payType,
                       PayMedia media)
                throws PayException
        Deprecated since 5.1; use payment(long, int, de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ProductCategory[], de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.PayMedia) with empty productCategories parameter instead.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • paymentWithoutCard

        PayTransaction paymentWithoutCard(long cents,
                                  int payType,
                                  java.lang.String cardNr,
                                  int expiredMonth,
                                  int expiredYear,
                                  ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                                  PayMedia media)
                           throws PayException
        This method starts a payment transaction without any card present. The behavior is simmilar to PayTerminal#payment(), except that no card is requested from the cardReader and no PIN has to be inserted in the PINPad. For further details see the payment method.
        Parameters:
        cents - The fund used for the payment of goods.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        cardNr - The manually given card number
        expiredMonth - The month of the valid-till date (January = 1)
        expiredYear - The year of the valid-till date (4 digits, like 2014)
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        payment(long, int, de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ProductCategory[], de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.PayMedia)

      • refund

        PayTransaction refund(long cents,
                      int payType,
                      ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                      PayMedia media)
               throws PayException
        This method starts a refund transaction.

        See the method payment for further details.

        Parameters:
        cents - The fund used for the payment of goods.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        payment(long, int, de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ProductCategory[], de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.PayMedia)

      • refundWithoutCard

        PayTransaction refundWithoutCard(long cents,
                                 int payType,
                                 java.lang.String cardNr,
                                 int expiredMonth,
                                 int expiredYear,
                                 ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                                 PayMedia media)
                          throws PayException
        Method to start a refund without inserting a card. You only have to know the cardNr and its expiry date.
        Parameters:
        cents - The amount of the refund.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        cardNr - The manually given card number
        expiredMonth - The month of the valid-till date (January = 1)
        expiredYear - The year of the valid-till date (4 digits, like 2014)
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • readChipCard

        ChipCard readChipCard(short cardType)
               throws PayException
        Method to directly access the chip card on an inserted card. This method will NOT read any magnetic tracks on the card.
        Parameters:
        cardType - The type of the chip to be read. Use one of the constant values of this class.
        Returns:
        An instance of ChipCard, which contains some darta of the chip.
        Throws:
        PayException

        WILL BE CHANGED. DON'T USE IT.
        Throws:
        PayException - Deprecated

      • reconciliation

        PayResultSales reconciliation()
                       throws PayException
        Method to show the turnover totals of all cards and make a reconciliation/end-of-day. The turnover totals will be delivered to the network provider. After this call, the turnover totals are set to zero. You will receive printMessage-Events, if you have registered a PayMessageListener.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        turnoverTotals()

      • turnoverTotals

        PayResultSales turnoverTotals()
                       throws PayException
        Method to show the turnover totals of all cards. After this call, the eft has still its turnover totals. If you want to zero them, call 'reconciliation' instead. You will receive printMessage-Events, if you have registered a PayMessageListener.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        reconciliation()

      • getLastReconciliationDate

        long getLastReconciliationDate()
        Every reconciliation saves its finishing time in the config file. This Date is returned. Its value is a long, representing the elapsed milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT
        Returns:
        Returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT for the last reconciliation (end-of-day).

      • diagnose

        PayResult diagnose(short diagnoseType)
            throws PayException
        Checks the payment terminal and starts a testing routine. Different action take place, depending on the given diagnoseType.
        Parameters:
        diagnoseType - See the constants in this class for possible values.
        Throws:
        PayException

            throws PayException

      • reset

        void reset()
    throws PayException
        With thje help of this method, a software reset will be started within the payment terminal. Such a reset may take 60 seconds. After a reset, one has to login again.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • resetTerminalID

        void resetTerminalID()
              throws PayException
        Sets the payment terminal ID to undefined. This step is needed to initialize an out-of-order procedure within the payment terminal. After this step, the payment terminal has to be initialized and granted access to the network provider.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • callMaintenanceCenter

        void callMaintenanceCenter(java.lang.String batchNr)
                    throws PayException
        This method connects to the maintenance center and looks up for some batch jobs. If there are jobs, the payment terminal will download and execute them.

        These jobs are a possible (but not mandatory) way to actualize the firmware of the device.

        Parameters:
        batchNr - The name of the batch job. If name=null, only the maintenance center will be contacted without doing something further.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • initialStartup

        PayResult initialStartup(PayMessageListener listener)
                  throws PayException
        This method initializes the payment terminal and grants access to the network provider. During the initialization, all values in the zvt.cfg configuration file will be used to configure the payment terminal.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • setLanguage

        void setLanguage(java.lang.String lang,
                 PayMessageListener listener)
          throws PayException
        Method to define the language of the display texts on the pinpad.
        See ISO639 for further details.
        Parameters:
        lang - The ISO639 conform language string (2 chars long). Samples: "en" for English, "de" for german, "fr" for french
        Throws:
        PayException

      • getTraceInfo

        java.lang.String getTraceInfo()
                       throws PayException
        In case of an error, this method preserves a string of trace informations of the last actions within the payment device. This information is delivered from the payment device directly, not from LUIS ePayment. It will not be formatted in any case.
        This method is for administration purposes only.
        Never use this method within a normal payment process. It takes some time to fetch the trace informations from the device, which would prolong the payment procedure for too long.
        Returns:
        A String with trace information, depending on the underlying payment device.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • printReceipt

        PayResult printReceipt(java.lang.String receiptTxt)
                throws PayException
        Prints a receipt, defined by the client, on the internal EFT printer.
        Requires the activation of the internal EFT printer in the PayConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        receiptTxt - The receipt to be printed. Lines are seperated by the machine dependend line break (eg. Win: CR+LF, Unix: LF).
        Throws:
        PayException

        Throws:
        PayException

        Parameters:
        receiptType - Constraint of the receipt type ()
        Throws:
        PayException

      • printReceiptNr

        PayResult printReceiptNr(int receiptNrFrom,
                         int receiptNrTo)
                  throws PayException
        Sends a command to print/return all receipts with receipt numbers in the given range.
        Parameters:
        receiptNrFrom - First receipt number to of the receipt to be printed
        receiptNrTo - Last receipt number to of the receipt to be printed
        Throws:
        PayException

      • printReceiptNr

        PayResult printReceiptNr(java.lang.Integer receiptNrFrom,
                         java.lang.Integer receiptNrTo,
                         ReceiptType receiptType)
                  throws PayException
        Repeats all receipts with matching receipt type and receipt number in the given range.
        Parameters:
        receiptNrFrom - First receipt number to of the receipt to be printed
        receiptNrTo - Last receipt number to of the receipt to be printed
        receiptType - Constraint of the receipt type (@link de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ReceiptType)
        Throws:
        PayException

      • selftest

        Throws:
        PayException

      • setDateTime

        void setDateTime(int year,
                 int month,
                 int day,
                 int hour,
                 int min,
                 int sec)
          throws PayException
        Sets the date and time in the EFT. Normally, the time will be synchronized during a diagnose with the network provider. But in some circumstances (offline for a longer time) this method is usefull.
        Parameters:
        year - An integer value representation the year, eg 2014
        month - An integer value for the month. Rage is {1-12}, so you have to take care, when in some languages the January starts with a different value than 1.
        day - The day of the month {1-31}.
        hour - The hour of the day {0-23}
        min - The minutes of the hour {0-59}
        sec - The seconds of the minute {0-59}
        Throws:
        PayException

      • changeMerchantPin

        void changeMerchantPin(java.lang.String oldPIN,
                       java.lang.String newPIN)
                throws PayException
        Method to change the merchant pin in the EFT. Because the merchant PIN is part of the PayConfiguration, its value is changed there as well.
        Parameters:
        oldPIN - The previous merchant PIN
        newPIN - The new merchant PIN
        Throws:
        PayException

      • reversal

        PayResult reversal(int receiptNr,
                   long cents,
                   ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                   PayMedia media)
            throws PayException
        Method to start a reversal of a previous transaction (payment/refund).
        Parameters:
        receiptNr - The receipt number of the previous transaction.
        cents - The total amount [in cents] to be reversed. Currently a partial reversal is no supported, so the whole amount of the previous transaction has to be reversed.
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains informations about the card used for reversal.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • reversal

        PayResult reversal(int receiptNr,
                   long cents,
                   PayMedia media)
            throws PayException
        Deprecated since 5.1; use reversalWithoutCard(int, long, String, int, int, ProductCategory[], PayMedia) with empty productCategories parameter instead.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • reversalWithoutCard

        PayResult reversalWithoutCard(int receiptNr,
                              long cents,
                              java.lang.String cardNr,
                              int expiredMonth,
                              int expiredYear,
                              ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                              PayMedia media)
                       throws PayException
        Reverts a previous transaction (payment/refund) without re-inserting the card again.
        Parameters:
        receiptNr - The receipt number of the previous transaction.
        cents - The total amount [in cents] to be reversed. Currently a partial reversal is no supported, so the whole amount of the previous transaction has to be reversed.
        cardNr - The cardNr of the card used in the the previous transaction.
        expiredMonth - The validity (month ={1..12}) of the card used in previous transaction
        expiredYear - The validity (year, eg 2015) of the card used in previous transaction
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains informations about the card used for reversal.
        Throws:
        PayException

      • reservation

        PayTransaction reservation(long cents,
                           int payType,
                           ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                           PayMedia media)
                    throws PayException
        Invoke this method to start a reservation. The given amount is verified and reserved for a future booking. The reserved amount can be increased by PayTerminal.increaseReservation or PayTerminal.increaseReservationWithoutCard() and finally booked by PayTerminal.booking() or PayTerminal.bookingWithoutCard(). This method is usefull in situations, where only the maximum amount is known in the beginning and the exact amount is determined in a later process. The difference between reservated and booked amount is reversed.
        Parameters:
        cents - The amount to be reserved.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        increaseReservation(long, int, int, String, ProductCategory[], PayMedia), increaseReservationWithoutCard(long, int, String, int, int, int, String, ProductCategory[], PayMedia), booking(long, long, int, int, String, Boolean, ProductCategory[], PayMedia), bookingWithoutCard(long, long, int, String, int, int, int, String, Boolean, ProductCategory[], PayMedia)

      • reservationWithoutCard

        PayTransaction reservationWithoutCard(long cents,
                                      int payType,
                                      java.lang.String cardNr,
                                      int expiredMonth,
                                      int expiredYear,
                                      ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                                      PayMedia media)
                               throws PayException
        Same method as PayTerminal.reservation(), but no need to insert a card in the card reader.
        Parameters:
        cents - The amount to be reserved.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        cardNr - The number of a card (can be given via phone).
        expiredMonth - The month {1,..,12} of the valid-till date of the card (can be given via phone)
        expiredYear - The year (eg. 2014) of the valid-till date of the card (can be given via phone)
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        reservation(long, int, ProductCategory[], PayMedia)

      • increaseReservation

        PayTransaction increaseReservation(long cents,
                                   int payType,
                                   int traceNr,
                                   java.lang.String aid,
                                   ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                                   PayMedia media)
                            throws PayException
        Convenience method to increase a previously reserved amount. See PayTerminal.reservation() for further details.
        Parameters:
        cents - The amount to be added on the previously reserved amount.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        traceNr - The trace number ('traceNr' or 'TA-NR') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        aid - The authorisation ID ('AID' or 'GenehmigungsNr') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        reservation(long, int, ProductCategory[], PayMedia)

      • increaseReservationWithoutCard

        PayTransaction increaseReservationWithoutCard(long cents,
                                              int payType,
                                              java.lang.String cardNr,
                                              int expiredMonth,
                                              int expiredYear,
                                              int traceNr,
                                              java.lang.String aid,
                                              ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                                              PayMedia media)
                                       throws PayException
        Same method as PayTerminal.increaseReservation(), but no need to insert a card in the card reader.
        Parameters:
        cents - The amount to be added on the previously reserved amount.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        cardNr - The number of a card (can be given via phone).
        expiredMonth - The month {1,..,12} of the valid-till date of the card (can be given via phone)
        expiredYear - The year (eg. 2014) of the valid-till date of the card (can be given via phone)
        traceNr - The trace number ('traceNr' or 'TA-NR') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        aid - The authorisation ID ('AID' or 'GenehmigungsNr') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        increaseReservation(long, int, int, java.lang.String, de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ProductCategory[], de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.PayMedia)

      • booking

        PayTransaction booking(long cents,
                       long reservedCents,
                       int payType,
                       int traceNr,
                       java.lang.String aid,
                       java.lang.Boolean isGiroMaestro,
                       ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                       PayMedia media)
                throws PayException
        Method to finalize a reservation. The specified amount will finally be booked. It is not possible, to increase the reserved amount with this method. So you can at most book, what has been reserved before. The difference between reserved and booked amount is reversed and can't be used for a second booking. See PayTerminal.increaseReservation() for further details.
        Parameters:
        cents - The final amount to be booked. The customer has to pay only this amount, which is always less or equal the reserved amount.
        reservedCents - The amount to be reserved before. If the reserved amount was increased, the sum of all amounts has to be used here.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        traceNr - The trace number ('traceNr' or 'TA-NR') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        aid - The authorisation ID ('AID' or 'GenehmigungsNr') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        isGiroMaestro - Boolean flag to signal the usage of a girocard or Maestro card.
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        increaseReservation(long, int, int, java.lang.String, de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ProductCategory[], de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.PayMedia)

      • bookingWithoutCard

        PayTransaction bookingWithoutCard(long cents,
                                  long reservedCents,
                                  int payType,
                                  java.lang.String cardNr,
                                  int expiredMonth,
                                  int expiredYear,
                                  int traceNr,
                                  java.lang.String aid,
                                  java.lang.Boolean isGiroMaestro,
                                  ProductCategory[] productCategories,
                                  PayMedia media)
                           throws PayException
        Same method as PayTerminal.booking(), but no need to insert a card in the card reader.
        Parameters:
        cents - The final amount to be booked. The customer has to pay only this amount, which is always less or equal the reserved amount.
        reservedCents - The amount to be reserved before. If the reserved amount was increased, the sum of all amounts has to be used here.
        payType - Flag to signal a whish in using a limit driven transaction (PAY_TYPE_AUTOMATIC), a pure online (PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_PIN, PAY_TYPE_ONLINE_NO_PIN) or offline (PAY_TYPE_OFFLINE) transaction. Some transactions need to be online, if
        • cards are used, that are only allowed to be used in online mode
        • the fund is to high for an offline transaction
        cardNr - The number of a card used during reservation.
        expiredMonth - The month {1,..,12} of the valid-till date of the card during reservation
        expiredYear - The year (eg. 2014) of the valid-till date of the card during reservation
        traceNr - The trace number ('traceNr' or 'TA-NR') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        aid - The authorisation ID ('AID' or 'GenehmigungsNr') of the previous reservation. This number can be found on the receipt.
        isGiroMaestro - Boolean flag to signal the usage of a girocard or Maestro card.
        productCategories - Array of PayProductCategory (can be empty).
        media - This is a reference parameter. It contains in case of a successfully startet transaction the kind of the used payment card.
        Returns:
        A newly created instance of PayTransaction, where the transaction can be committed or rolled back.
        This instance can be null, when the underlying eft device doesn't support transactions. In that case, the transaction is comitted and finished, when no exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PayException
        See Also:
        booking(long, long, int, int, java.lang.String, java.lang.Boolean, de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.ProductCategory[], de.luis.kioskComponents.ePayment.PayMedia)
